newsitem.title: USA: Miami arena vote results to be made public--ruling.
newsitem.headline: Miami arena vote results to be made public--ruling.

text.p: Results of Dade County's Nov 5 arena referendum will be made public even if the referendum is later ruled invalid, Circuit Judge Ronald Friedman said.
A political action group that opposes public funding for the $165 million basketball arena collected enough voter signatures to put the measure on the ballot.
But the Miami Heat, which would play in the new facility, sued to block the referendum on grounds that the ballot question was misleading and unconstitutionlly addressed more than one topic.

Friedman said last week that he would release his ruling on the validity of the measure at 2000 EST Nov 5, one hour after the polls close. The decision did not address whether the results should remain sealed pending appeals.
In a three-page order Wednesday, Friedman instructed the elections department to tally and release the results of the vote.
"The public undoubtedly has a desire to know," Friedman said in the order.
If Friedman finds the ballot question to be illegal, the results would be void.
